Thread hh/55

Csaba Hoch "the" Hm? <hh/55> <root> (2009-03-29) 
Should we write "the" before the word "Heapmanipulator"?
Attila Nagy — <hh/56> <↑hh/55> (2009-03-29) 
Definitely not. Programs are without "the", even when abbreviated.
Csaba Hoch — <hh/57> <↑hh/56> (2009-03-30) 
Thanks. And when I write just "Manipulator"? Or maybe I shouldn't
write that? :)
Attila Nagy — <hh/60> <↑hh/57> (2009-04-04) 
> And when I write just "Manipulator"?

Whenever you feel like sparing 4 chars :)
Csaba Hoch — <hh/61> <↑hh/60> (2009-04-04) 
No, I mean when I write just "Manipulator", should I write "the"?
Attila Nagy — <hh/62> <↑hh/61> (2009-04-04) 
An example. When two Linux developers meet, they can refer to Linux as
"the kernel". If similarly it can be stated that "Heapmanipulator is a
manipulator", then you can refer to it as "the manipulator".
Otherwise, only "Manipulator", without "the".
